metadata.title: CVE-2023-52794 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:thermal: intel: powerclamp: fix mismatch in get function for max_idle KASANreported this [ 444.853098] BUG: KASAN: global-out-of-bounds inparam_get_int+0x77/0x90 [ 444.853111] Read of size 4 at addrffffffffc16c9220 by task cat/2105 ... [ 444.853442] The buggy addressbelongs to the variable: [ 444.853443] max_idle+0x0/0xffffffffffffcde0[intel_powerclamp] There is a mismatch between the param_get_int and thedefinition of max_idle. Replacing param_get_int with param_get_byteresolves this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
